hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 20D Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility compresses below 35% while its price consolidates within a 5% range for 10 days, a breakout above the consolidation high on >1.5x average volume signals an imminent transition to a BULL regime, offering a high-probability long entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes strong directional moves. A high-volume breakout from such compression suggests institutional accumulation and a shift in market structure. The 35% volatility threshold identifies periods of suppressed risk appetite ready to expand.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low) over last 10 days < 5% of current price
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% price appreciation from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%) and holds for 3 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts fail to sustain (price returns below breakout level within 3 days) OR lead to BEAR regime >30% of the time.
